byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Republican presidential hopeful Herman Cain contends voters are overcoming their hesitations about his ability to gain the nomination, citing surge in his polls.
snippet: With a surge in the polls, Herman Cain’s crowds have been standing room only, which he attributes to voters overcoming hesitations about his ability to gain the nomination.
lead_paragraph: With a surge in the polls, Herman Cain’s crowds have been standing room only, which he attributes to voters overcoming hesitations about his ability to gain the nomination.

headline.main: Tested Again and Again, Cain Takes Comfort in His Rise in the Polls
headline.print_headline: Tested Again and Again, Cain Takes Comfort in His Rise in the Polls
headline.seo: Tested Again, Herman Cain Seeks Comfort in His Rise in the Polls
